page.title: 19INNS AND PUBS IN EARLS COLNE
page.content: Many pubs are situated in Earls Colne. Behind Earls Colne's Vicarage is a house called Cobblestones which was once an inn,called the Blue Boar. Opposite Cobblestones is Twin Gables which use to be a pub,it was called the Dolphin House.People stayed there overnight. The Dolphin was owned by Edmund Potter and soon his son took over.The next building is the Castle Inn,it was built between 1375_1550 but only parts of it remain,but it is still a pub.It was first owned by William Burdock.The George, now known as the Coachman Inn ,used to be the forge for Priory Manor. The Riverside Inn as it is now known, used to be called The Anchor.It is right next to the River Colne.It used to be called the River House,as it was a mill at one time.
